abstract: Jin Liqun, interim head of Chinese-led Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank, says institution, which is expected to start operations at end of 2015, will strive to be corruption free, maintain environmentally sound policies and work with streamlined bureaucracy.
lead_paragraph: China’s new development bank will strive to be corruption free, maintain environmentally sound policies and work with a streamlined bureaucracy, the interim head of the institution said.

headline.main: New China-Led Bank Pledges to Fend Off Graft
headline.print_headline: New China-Led Bank Pledges to Fend Off Graft

snippet: China’s new development bank will strive to be corruption free, maintain environmentally sound policies and work with a streamlined bureaucracy, the interim head of the institution said.
